statement:
Groups that act freely and without inversions on trees are free.

Let $\Gamma$ be a group acting freely and without inversions by graph
automorphisms on a tree $T$. Since $\Gamma$ acts freely on $T$, the
quotient graph $T/\Gamma$ is well-defined, and $T$ is the universal
cover of $T/\Gamma$ since $T$ is contractible. Thus by faithfulness
$\Gamma\cong\pi_1(X/\Gamma)$. Since any graph is homotopy equivalent to
a wedge of circles, and the fundamental group of such a space is free by
Van Kampen’s theorem, $\Gamma$ is free.
names: groups that act freely on trees are free
